solution_line_template: For half of the cupcakes, Stephanie wants to use {candles_per_cupcake_half1} candle each. Since half of the cupcakes is {total_cupcakes}/{half_divisor} and she plans to use {candles_per_cupcake_half1} candle each for this half of the cupcakes, Stephanie needs ({total_cupcakes}/{half_divisor})*{candles_per_cupcake_half1} = <<{total_cupcakes}/{half_divisor}*{candles_per_cupcake_half1}={candles_for_half1}>>{candles_for_half1} candles for this half of the cupcakes.

For the other half of the cupcakes, Stephanie wants to use {candles_per_cupcake_half2} candles. Therefore, she will need ({total_cupcakes}/{half_divisor})*{candles_per_cupcake_half2} =<<{total_cupcakes}/{half_divisor}*{candles_per_cupcake_half2}={candles_for_half2}>>{candles_for_half2} candles for this half of the cupcakes.

Because Stephanie needs {candles_for_half1} candles for half of the cupcakes and {candles_for_half2} candles for the other half, she needs a total of {candles_for_half1}+{candles_for_half2}=<<{candles_for_half1}+{candles_for_half2}={total_candles_needed}>>{total_candles_needed} candles.

Since Stephanie needs {total_candles_needed} candles to decorate all the cupcakes and she currently has {candles_currently_has} candles, Stephanie needs {total_candles_needed}-{candles_currently_has}= <<{total_candles_needed}-{candles_currently_has}={additional_candles_needed}>>{additional_candles_needed} additional candles.
